div.div: A slight chance of showers between noon and 4pm. Partly sunny, with a high near 70. Breezy, with a southeast wind 5 to 10 mph becoming south southwest 15 to 20 mph in the afternoon. Winds could gust as high as 30 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.
A 40 percent chance of showers, mainly after 10pm. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 52. South southwest wind 5 to 15 mph becoming southeast after midnight.
A 40 percent chance of showers. Mostly cloudy, with a high near 63. Southeast wind 5 to 10 mph becoming north northeast in the afternoon. Winds could gust as high as 15 mph.

div.div: Your session will expire in 0 minutes.

span.span: Covid-19 School Closure Food Service Procedures

Thank you for your extraordinary support over the past several days, as we have worked together to protect our community during the growing coronavirus/COVID-19 pandemic. To further safeguard Illinois from the spread of the virus, Governor JB Pritzker has declared mandatory school closures for all buildings, both public and private, serving pre-kindergarten through 12th grade students. This mandatory closure takes effect Tuesday, March 17. Currently, we anticipate reopening on April 8.
Free lunch and breakfast will be available to all students in grades K-12 regardless of your pay/free status. We want to ensure that all students that want a meal will get one.
The following procedures will be followed:
In-town Students can pick up a “Grab and Go” breakfast and lunch in the town in which they live. Students will not be allowed to stay at school and eat, they must take their meals to go.
In-town pick up times will be between 8:30 and 11:30 Monday, Wednesday and Friday
Students or their family members can pick up meals – students need not be present to get meals
Kempton in-town students should come to the cafeteria door by the alley
Piper City in-town students should come to the south door of the junior high wing by the bus garage
Cullom in-town students should come to the high school front door.
Students that live outside of Kempton, Piper City, and Cullom are considered to be rural delivery students.
Rural delivery students who have not yet received a meal can call the District Office to make arrangements. (815) 253-6299
Other rural delivery students including Stelle, will have meals dropped off at their home by school van or mini-bus starting at 9:00 each day. Deliveries may take a couple of hours to complete.

Students with in-town sitters will have to pick up meals in that town - students at sitters in the country can get their meals delivered to those locations as long as they are in the school district boundaries.
****Reminder – All rural students (including Cabery and Stelle) must call the district office at (815) 253-6299 on Monday, Wednesday or Friday between 8 - 11:30 to request meals.
